website_summaries.verdict: Excellent print quality for a portable printer from a trusted  name in printing.
pros: Very easy to connect this printer to a WiFi network, which makes it easy to print from a smartphone or tablet
Fast performance for small photo prints vs. some other portable printer options
Able to print at multiple paper sizes, unlike most portable printers
cons: Struggles to maintain a steady connection with some mobile device models

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal quality of prints and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a DIY wedding photo booth. I did a lot of research on 4 different types of printers for this project and I came up with this one. It exceeded my expectations for quality of print, price and size. 4x6" prints, fast print time and easy setup with their app. Easy to set up to wifi, make a template background and lock and set print display options. The guests loved it and were able to also send their photos to facebook, instagram, email and twitter. Plus we were able to keep all the photos taken. For the price and the amount of photos it could print, I would suggest this printer over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne MarcouxTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my gf for Christmas. She wanted a portable photo printer and I had read the great reviews on this one. Really glad I got this one. Super easy to load and print photos. Printing is fast and very hi res. She has a big printer that does photos, but wanted this one since it’s portable. Turns out, she likes using this one even when she’s near her big printer. I bought her the 108 print toner and paper kit, which turned out to be a great idea. If you want a photo printer, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Difficult getting support from SquareTrade, Amazon, or Canon.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second purchase of this product with the same outcome. The printer chews the ink cartridge and wraps around the roller.
customer_reviews.author: dr jmWilson

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed with Canon....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kids for Christmas. They loved it, but with most presents, it got put away for a while. It has been sitting on the shelf for almost a year and now they wanted to start printing pictures again. INK AND CARTRIDGE errors. Tried reaching out to Canon who told me it's no longer under warranty. I tried a new ink cartridge AND new paper....still nothing. Their iphones connect to the printer and all but it just won't print. DON'T BUY THIS JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.author: TeamBOAH

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend this enough
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I doubted the quality of the picture simply due to the low price point. But I was blown away by how quick and easy it was to use the printer. The optional smartphone app offered by Canon works like a charm. Very simple setup, excellent image quality and very compatible app. I except nothing more from a wireless compact photo printer at this price point. Perfect gift/tool for sharing memories with family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Indelebi

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this printer!!! It is so convenient there is no wait time to print out photos unless you run out of ink and paper lol Pros -portable -great quality -convenient -WiFi connection -print straight from your cellphone Cons -I wish it came with more than 5 sheets of photo paper that it came with I have posted videos on my social media IG, Snapchat @BrainyCreativit
customer_reviews.author: Y. Gallardo

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value.
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great, but I was shocked to learn that the ink cartridge only prints 5 pictures. This will get expensive, especially if you include what I paid for the printer. Will most likely still use Walgreens for most photo printing. Wouldn't have purchased if I had known.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Bayer

customer_reviews.title: Why?
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews before this purchase. They were misleading to me due to people saying they were professional or semi professionals. I find this hard to believe due to the fact that you can not print a pic that has been edited. So I could not print a single picture from my computer because I have an expensive editing software and this printer is useless for this....So I ask why would you even make a printer that does not print edited photos. I did not get to send back due to not having the time. Will keep for kids to play with or the occasional perfect pic taken on my cell phone. Alabama
customer_reviews.author: Brandie

customer_reviews.title: I like the device itself
customer_reviews.text: Except for the App that you have to use to print, I like the device itself. I've never used any of SELPHY product, so I can't compare to any previous models, but this little device does its job nicely. I use Iphone7 plus and before I print any pictures, I'll have edit photo ratio to 4:3, then I can see what's to be actually printed. The app doesn't do anything to edit the photo, so you will have to edit on your photo gallery before print it.
customer_reviews.author: Jhwa

customer_reviews.title: Finally a SELPHY that works with iPhone
customer_reviews.text: This printer is functionally identical to the two previous SELPHY models have I owned over the last 15 years or so. Unlike the previous one which we replaced when we no longer had any computers that could print to it this one uses air print and thus works with everything. The start up time after plugging in and turning on may be a tad longer and this engine has never been fast, but that is entirely masked by the ease of printing directly from the phone. I haven't tried the buttons or screen as I've never seen a need.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Dickson

customer_reviews.title: it’s amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!! My friend told me about this photo printer she used for her wedding pictures and I bought it, it’s amazing!!! So much cheaper than Walmart and Costco.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkyjenn1

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself to be tech savvy. But this machine is hard to set up. After set up, printing pictures is another adventure. You only get part of the picture and when I tried to crop or do any kind of editing, message says this model doesn't allow for editing. What a piece of turd. The part of the picture that printed looked great, but who wants pictures with the heads cut off?
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Crops every picture
customer_reviews.text: I had the cp900 and after 2 long years of use it broke. I ordered this one. It does not print the full size image - I have tried using endless apps for sizing the proper aspect ration etc and it still cuts the images off. It’s truly annoying. If that doesn’t bother and you don’t mind half of a face being cut off then this is your printer. The interface on the printer is terrible and there is no adjustment via that end. Sad my old one bit the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Feller

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally was able to hookup my printer! I love it. It WiFi connected to all my Apple devices and my camera works great. Make sure you buy extra canon paper and printer cartridges what comes with it is a trial out the system . I bought the carrier and canon 2 boxes. Works great! Nice quality Ipictures for the money and WiFi setup was fast . Very happy. I did purchase a cable in case WiFi doesn’t work but didn’t need it. But just to be safe you will need one . Doesn’t come with any hookup cables.
customer_reviews.author: kathy J

customer_reviews.title: Will only last one year-this is my 3rd one
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd one of this model. Each one last for one year only. But i still have paper and ink. .... Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Gzbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Photos print very washed out. My multipurpose Epson printer does a better job with generic ink. I didn't think the small tray would bother me as much either, but it does. The odd amount of paper that it holds combined with the quantity that comes with the refills is annoying if you are trying to do a lot of printing. Lack of messaging in the mobile app (out of paper, out of ink, etc.) makes it less than pleasant to use.
customer_reviews.author: GRey1

customer_reviews.title: Good printer; expensive upkeep
customer_reviews.text: I love this little printer SO MUCH! It’s super easy to use. Pick a picture, select print, pick the Cannon, and seconds later out comes this beautiful photo. The colors are super vibrant. “Why only rate three stars” you ask? Well... the thing came with 5 pieces of paper. FIVE! And from what I can gather it costs nearly half of what I paid for the printer to purchase more. They cost is ASTRONOMICAL considering... Had I known this I might not have bought this at all to only print 4x6s.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bright

customer_reviews.title: No, just dont
customer_reviews.text: While the photo quality is good, the overall ease of use is ridiculously poor. When trying to print wirelessly it can’t stay connected, shuts down mid-print wasting ink and paper, shows that it is connected, but displays error message that it isn’t connected. More frustrating than its worth. Don’t make the same mistake, I’m stuck with an expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love prints, love the way it does print
customer_reviews.text: Wish it was touchscreen and my fingerprints on the screen are testament to that. To the product folks, the only reason I really wish it was touchscreen is the icons are layout and displayed in a way that are simple wanting to be touched. Change to a list or something and you'll get less complaints about not having touchscreen...or put in a touchscreen. Love prints, love the way it does print. So happy I can now print my own snapshots and photos at home. Have a large format printing for other photography stuff, but I suspect this will be go to for proof work and sharing photos like old times.
customer_reviews.author: R Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little printer!
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these for photo booth use at my church. I set them up side by side and prepare my phone and an ipad to connect with both. It's amazing what these let you do! The printing can get a little backed up if folks expect it instantly, but I worked around that issue by inviting folks to return for their photos. For the money the paper+cassette packages are a decent value as well. All in all, this is an impressive product from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Cool little machine for home use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my office to print pictures and save on ultrasound machine paper/ink pictures PROS: Larger pics without all your personal info You can crop the pictures Cool for a cheap printer for home.. ink is cheap CONS: More work and time.. You have to go through ALL the pictures 1 by 1 Pictures not as clear as I would like can only fit 18 pieces of paper in the slot... YES, you have to count out 18 or less lol Its a personal preference, just not for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Cavimom

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT- USELESS MANUAL
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a kaput Canon photo printer bought awhile ago. While allegedly wireless, I couldn't find ANYWHERE in the useless manual (both the short-form that came with the unit and the longer one online) how to hook it up to my wireless network. I'm a retired Electrical Engineer so I'm not a luddite! I gave up and unfortunatly have it hardwired, via USB, to one of my computers on the network. Shame on you, Canon- it would've been 5 stars for the printer but only 3 stars for the printer/manual package.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient printing.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use once you link your WiFi connection. I use the app and control everything from my phone. The biggest drawback is the print quality it’s good don’t get me wrong but compared to the iPhone image details that enrich the photo are diminished or not represented at all. This is an awesome printer for those who want good prints that aren’t fussy about details. First image is on the unedited print and second is iPhone image.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Ink Cartridge broke within 6mos of purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in December '19, used for Christmas pics, put away until now (July '20), pulled out to make new prints only to find the ink cartridge is broken. Upon examination, I noticed that there was a strange color "film" coming out of the cartridge, so I tried to take the cartridge out of the printer and it would not budge. Purchased through Amazon and they said they couldn't do anything to help me. The printer had a 30 day window to return! So, here I sit with a broken printer. $100 down the drain. I'm pissed.
customer_reviews.author: TGPatton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home-use photobooth printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a personal, home-use, photobooth printer I set up for family gatherings (i.e. kids parties, holidays...). I didn't want to payout for a more professional set up as that's not the business i'm in. i only use this for home gatherings where speed is not of concern. This, paired with a cheap (compatible) camera and software can get you a photobooth up and running for less than $700, or way less if you already have a compatible camera. This works for my needs. I don't really print 4X6 photos otherwise, so this will be it's sole purpose. Not bad for $100.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K.

customer_reviews.title: This Only Works With Their Paper
customer_reviews.text: You cannot print unless you buy paper from Canon. Screw that. This thing is a giant lump of crap. It will not print to any other paper. At all.
customer_reviews.author: that one dude

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of technology
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a diy photo booth for my event. Works great and got lots of interest on where to get one. I love how convenient the printing is. The image comes out great as well. However, it does take a few rounds of printing to layer on the image with the colors. I also experienced it freezing a few times when I had a lot of pictures to print, which is understandable. I would just restart it and when it came online, it automatically printed out the orders without me having to try to reprint. Overall, it's so useful and I would order again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 16 months. Warranty 1 year. I'm out of luck and it is going to the landfill.
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this again. The paper won't load and I get an error message to check the paper cassette. Yes, I tried all the suggested steps to fix. I contacted Canon and for $129 they will repair it. I can buy one for $115. How crazy is that? I don't like cheap products that break quickly and lack company support. I have many other Canon products with which I have had a good experience and seen good reliability. This is not one of those.
customer_reviews.author: ADK

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was really skeptical of these instant photo printers, but am really happy with the simplicity, functionality and quality of the prints. I have mine connected to my WiFi network so I can print from Windows and Mac. I haven't tried to print from smartphone or tablet yet. I am really impressed with dye sublimation printing and find the prints far less expensive to produce than alternatives like Fugi's Instax or HP/Canon ZINK prints. One of the best features is it prints standard 4x6 photo size. I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. So glad I got one
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this. The pictures are quite expensive and by the way, you only get like 4 pictures included with this so make sure you buy paper and ink separately. Anyways, they’re expensive per photo but I enjoy printing from home rather than from Walmart. Great quality photos and my ink matches my photo paper count perfectly. I’ll keep using this forever :)
customer_reviews.author: Joci McCann

customer_reviews.title: Best photo prints ever
customer_reviews.text: This new Canon prints the best photos I have ever seen from any Inkjet printer. However, It comes with terrible setup Instructions that don't make any sense until you learn that navigating the printer functions themselves are quite easy to set up straight from the unit Itself. Also Printing cable Is nonstandard USB male A to small B,(not micro or regular), not Included, a pain In the a$$. Why Canon doesn't mention this on their website page I do not understand. Once you get past these quirks and see the photos It produces you'll be happy with your purchase. Also seems to be designed quite well but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Color is bad! Functionality is sporadic. Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this to replace my CP800 which is no longer supported by canon for current Macs. The color is blue and not consistent. Thru the cause of several days trying every connection method the printer will not stay connected and freezes up mid print cue. Big time suck to back track and figure out where it left off. Very dispointed. Just picked up and Epson PM-400 and so far its better in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great Prints!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer because my husband quickly needed to have a picture of himself to attach to an application & I am one that takes many photos, but never prints them out. By the time I would try to with a multifunction printer, the photo ink would dry out, and it didn't always print well anyway. This little Selphy, however, is impressive! It was easy to understand and set up. I used a picture from my Android cell phone and sent it to the printer via Bluetooth. The picture I needed to print for my husband came out perfect! I am extremely pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: SueZQ

customer_reviews.title: Best quality photos!
customer_reviews.text: At first I bought the HP Sprocket and absolutely hated the quality of the photos. I liked how small it was but the Canon Selphy is just a million times better. The photo quality is just as good as getting photos developed at like Walgreens. It’s not as small as a portable printer as I would like, but the quality of the photos tremendously outweighs that little detail for me
customer_reviews.author: Alexis B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of photo printers in my day but none as good as the Canon Selphy. The paper and ink cartridge load in seconds and the print quality is the best I've ever seen...I don't mean the best in a small printer, I mean best ever! Small and compact, it fits easily on my desk and is extremely portable. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Everett

customer_reviews.title: So far not impress, the ink color is off
customer_reviews.text: I think I figured it out. When you open the photo app on your phone you have to click share and then click print. So far not a bad printer it prints really fast but the coloring is off. If the original picture is a really good picture and have the perfect lighting then it will print just fine. Once I print a picture you can definitely see the difference. I am wondering is it worth keeping and spending money buying ink and paper or just spend money going to Walmart and have them print them. I ma still not sold on if I want to return it or not.
customer_reviews.author: candyce jones

customer_reviews.title: Good pictures if I make a quick adjustment to each picture first
customer_reviews.text: Using my galaxy s9 to print pictures was easy once I downloaded the mopria print app. The canon app was really annoying and I couldn't get access to my pictures that were on internal storage. The pictures themselves are good. To me, colors look slightly washed out. My quick fix for this is just turning up the saturation in my pictures before I send them to the printer. After turning up the saturation, the pictures look better to my eyes. I wish there was an adjustment on the printer itself but I couldn't find one.
customer_reviews.author: Laprizzle

customer_reviews.title: Loved by 70+ Yr old Tech Resistant Grandma
customer_reviews.text: My mom wanted to print pictures of the grandkids, but hates learning new technology. We set it up for her, NO WiFi OR ROUTER NEEDED!!!! Yay, she was able to print pictures from her Samsung smartphone in minutes. She is very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Bootiesr

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this April of 2018. This is the second time I purchased this printer the first time I purchased it it fried out within three months the second one I purchased which is the one I’m reviewing just fried out and I don’t use this printer very often very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Deena Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Work all day at a party without any problems.
customer_reviews.text: I used this at a family party to share photos. It was connected and printing all day, and except for a problem with a usb hub (not the printer's fault) it worked flawlessly. having the prints come out "dry" and ready to handle was great for sharing and showing around the pictures, the colors were great and everyone was impressed. I liked that the paper and ribbon were coordinated so I could replace both at the same time, minimizing interruptions. I wish I could have connected the wifi directly to the computer (it must go thru a hub/access point) so I could have eliminated the usb cable.
customer_reviews.author: 3to5

customer_reviews.title: Works Surprisingly Well. Great Photos. Highly Recommend. Get a 108 pack refill (only comes with 8)
customer_reviews.text: This unit works very well. The quality of photos are the same as having them printed at the store. Each photo costs about $0.27, which is not bad for the convenience. It prints out a photo in a few seconds and they are instantly dry. Connects wireless to your phone via "wifi" but it doesn't log into a wifi connection. It just communicates with the phone via wifi. We didn't see the needs to download the cannon application. My Android had a print option in my Google Photo app and the Iphone had the option as well in Iphoto. Setup is very simple and only takes a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. It is the most frustrating product. 3/4 of the time the printer registers there is no paper (when the paper has been correctly loaded). Then it jams and won’t work. On average it takes 10 min to print a pic, with 9 of those min cursing that I have to keep reloading the paper. Each time it turns on you have to re-enable it to connect to the WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: Chad f.

customer_reviews.title: Great little photo printer!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a black and white laser printer to replace the ink jet that was drying up ink faster than I could use it. However, that meant no more printing photos. Then, I found this and decided to give it a try. Love it! It prints great quality 4x6 prints that can be framed, mailed as postcards, whatever! Although there are some other options for printing, I have not tried any of them. I have only printed directly from iPhone and am very pleased. *note, it only comes with trial ink/paper so order a refill if you want to hit the ground running and print more than a few photos*
customer_reviews.author: hamms

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Printer was fairly easy to set up. Produces a nice print. Have printed from my phone, tablet and PC. Does not however work with my chromebook/chromebox which is strange. I am curious why amazon was asking me to rate its touch screen as it has none. They also wanted me to rate its warmth. ???? I picked Canon over the others as all my camera's are Canon T series Rebels and I can direct connect. Also I use canon printers with my computers.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Freezes, gets stuck, disconnects or stops printing
customer_reviews.text: It’s convenient for a one time print. I purchased this printer because of its WiFi capability and photo booth sized prints. Unfortunately, after a row of 8 pictures, on average, the printer will stop printing or disconnect. Do NOT buy this printer if you are interested in a DIY photo booth. I would recommend looking into other options if that’s your goal. However, I would recommend this printer if you want a personal printer at home for only a couple photo prints, like for scrapbooking. Just be cautious when purchasing, it’s a good product, but make sure you buy the right product for the right job.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Does this work with android?
customer_reviews.text: I am missing something! Can't seem to get printer set up to print from my android phone. I am usually pretty tech savvy, but after hours, I finally got it to.print from my apple ipad, still working on android smartphone. Think this may be going back. Does anyone else have trouble with android pairing to printer??
customer_reviews.author: J Beauvais

customer_reviews.title: NO COMPLAINTS!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. 1) easy to use, mom proof 2) fast, people said it was slow but you get a print within a minute 3) dries instantly no smearing or something weird 4) good quality, doesn't look like it was printed on a crappy printer
customer_reviews.author: Jenniferwritesreviews

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Fits my purpose!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this today and just love it! I really wanted something at home to print a photo here and there for on my desk at work, kids show and tell, etc. it works great as I tested it out today - takes about 10 seconds to print. I was surprised that it prints the yellow, pulls it back in and prints the red, pulls it back in to print the blue, etc....but all in all it’s still fast and same quality as a drug store print. Don’t hesitate if you’ve been thinking about it - reasonably priced and very compact!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: great, low cost printer
customer_reviews.text: amazingly good prints considering the price. lowest cost per print. so much better than the results i've had with inkjets; dyesub is so much better. clearer, brighter, and... did i mention low cost? wish i could get an affordable eyesub for really BIG prints for those images i want to hang on the wall. on time delivery, good price, low operating cost, easy portability, what more could one want? (well, except larger prints)
customer_reviews.author: Tim Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Ink does not last long!
customer_reviews.text: Cute printer, quality of photos is better than most compact printers, fast print, fun to watch (one color prints at a time), however I used the ink cartridge in the box, and it only lasted 3 photos. Now I have the warning that it is out of ink. The printer itself comes with 4 sheet, and I have one sheet left to go but no ink. The ink cartridge should last more than 3 photos. A gift for the holidays that is expected to work at least for the holidays!! I am ordering ink ASAP but a bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Itak

customer_reviews.title: I. LOVE. THIS. If you have any doubts, I'm telling you get it!
customer_reviews.text: I had a family member pass away, so I wanted to print some photos off my phone and this printer is amazing!!! The photos come out so clear. You might have to adjust the photo before printing it, like add some contrast, sharpen up the image a bit. My mom even made me print some old photos she had on her phone of a family member and the photo just prints out so nicely! The size of the image is perfect too, not wallet size so i really appreciate that.
customer_reviews.author: Gaby

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is amazing! I wish I would have purchased one years ago. I had so much fun printing photos right from my phone wirelessly. It is so easy to set up, use, and store. I see myself using it to print photos of my family often! Thank you for an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Millenial daughter, she loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I've not been able to get my daughter to pictoralize her life like we used to. Snapping pics on your iPhone doesn't get it, we get rid of them and leave the iCloud forever. This printer does it all, I bought it so they could have friends and family over and put phone pics on stickers or 4 by 6prints. She expects to also use it for her wedding photos, no, they have not been developed either. Has lots of functions, hoping to get pics from her soon!
customer_reviews.author: RondaLee

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little printer for the price! The pictures look great. Easy to use. The only issue I can see is that an ink cartridge does not go very far. Plus you can’t just buy the ink cartridges, comes in sets with paper in every set so you end up with a lot more paper than ink.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Partlow

customer_reviews.title: I love this little machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could give my 93 year old mom pictures. Everytime I tried to show her something on my phone she deleted the picture somehow. I have since done collage frames for each of my grandkids (5) I have taken every picture off my phone or thru text messages and with the exception of one or two that were not great pictures to begin with every picture has turned out awesome. I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Several things: 1) It's mind numbingly slow 2) The pictures look fantastic 3) It's very easy to setup (loading paper, ink, connecting to phone app) The last two easily overwhelm the first point. It also has a pretty small footprint so finding a perch for it in my crowded workspace was not difficult. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Richard K. Nowalk

customer_reviews.title: Works great, good quality prints
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom who isn’t very tech savvy and she had an easy enough time using it once I gave her a few tutorials on how to use it. Picture quality is great for such a tiny printer and it’s fun to watch it work.
customer_reviews.author: Paige Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy!
customer_reviews.text: I did a bunch of research on photo printers from phones, I decided to go with this, and glad I did, the quality of the pictures is far better then I thought it would be. I used it to do a photo booth, so it was working pretty steadily. I only had 2 mishaps with it not picking up my phone. But after restarting it picked right up again. If things pick up I may get an additional to have
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Higham

customer_reviews.title: Great photo printer!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a surprise for my wife. She’s a scrapbooker and we were tired of bringing our files to the store for printing. We both fell in love with the picture quality and ease of use. The best feature is the dye-sublimation method it uses for printing. So much better than ink-jet. These prints don’t fade and they’re water resistant. Just amazing!
customer_reviews.author: JB Scribner

customer_reviews.title: Great phot printer!
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer for photos. Print directly from phone using app or from Google photo app with the Canon printer service installed. Colors good and printing fast enogh for my use. Looking forward to using this to share photos with others without having to look at small phone screen.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis E. Schoenman

customer_reviews.title: So close to being great. But falls short in critical ways.
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality when it prints well... but its success rate is like 75%. I returned the first printer due to print quality (would see random little flares of color show up in the print and would basically ruin the print). I got the replacement hoping it was just a fluke with the first machine. nope. This one does it too. It also has some connectivity issues and has had a problem printing more than 9 images in a row before it just crashes. Will be returning this one as well. Pretty crappy printer.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler H.

customer_reviews.title: Keep in mind
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product. However disappointed that I have to download an app just to get the printed. Thought I would just have to connect to the device and that would be it. With downloading the app you cannot change direction of photos nor can you change the size of the photo so that it fits exactly in the printed photo. Ex: a lot of my picture have half a face or are missing the top forehead portion.
customer_reviews.author: NakiaD16

customer_reviews.title: Great for my scrapbooking hobby
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. The quality of the photos are not super good but definitely no complaints about it. It is so easy to do it at home and not have to make trips back and forth to the stores to print your pics and it definitely make me feel better that I can do it on my own and not have someone else see all the pics that I print. Been using this machine to print pics for scrapbooking. Very easy to collage few pics and print out thru WiFi at home. Instructions are easy to read and the process went very smoothly and easy too.
customer_reviews.author: angelababy

customer_reviews.title: Portable size, good quality prints - Excellent printer!
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome purchase for my organization. We took pics of people and dogs and were able to immediately provide 4x6 prints of the pics. The prints came out quickly and were good quality. The small size, nice design, and good quality prints got a lot of compliments form the people who came through. The one downside was that the direct cord from camera to printer did not work. The printer did not recognize the device and we had to put a card reader into the USB port and switch cards from the camera to the printer (and back).
customer_reviews.author: William Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality prints - Not good for framing or gifting
customer_reviews.text: Definite marks on the photos where the color didn't fully transfer from the ink cartridge. Additionally, although, I adjusted color settings and brightness, there was no apparent change in the printed image. I only printed from the desktop and noticed there was no printer setting options for positioning the image, so some images were cropped around the edges to accommodate the photo paper size. I was hoping for crisper images but will return this in favor of online printing. The product is worth only the cheapest amount for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: gaustin

customer_reviews.title: Convienent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little printer. I love that I can connect any device in the house to it and print straight from the device. The print quality isn't shabby, but it could be a little better, although it could also be the film I'm using. Either way I am very satisfied with this purchase. I bought it for my wife as a valentines day gift to replace her old photo printer.
customer_reviews.author: Ministryman

customer_reviews.title: Ink.
customer_reviews.text: I only did four pictures and I had to replace the pictures. And starting on the fifth one I had to change the ink cartridge. Lucky I brought some more paper and ink. What if I didn't buy anymore. Thinking I had time. Then find out I had to buy more. Other then that, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Singleton

customer_reviews.title: luv this lil printer!
customer_reviews.text: prints great. I don't care for the app as much. Overall I love the camera and being able to use it with my phone. Love the versatility of choosing different pictures sizes. Great buy! Print quality is great!
customer_reviews.author: Von G.

customer_reviews.title: Best little printer around!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT little picture printer. The colors come out pretty true and I love it. All photos are 4" x 6", but you can print more than one on a page if you want smaller pics. I use 3 x 4 and 2 x 3 for most of my journals. Also prints (6) 2 x 2's. or many other configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Mi0

customer_reviews.title: It's fine
customer_reviews.text: The image quality is good, and it's easy enough to print a single photo from your phone. But any kind of customization (printing anything but a single large photo) is clunky. Everything is done on the printer itself, and take 1000 years to click through. Perfect for a wedding or big event, not great for photo projects and crafting, which is what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Cool little printer does as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting superior quality out of such a tiny printer but I was still pleasantly surprised at how good the prints are. Was a gift for my daughter, she opened and started printing within 15 mins. Easy set up to her phone, prints wireless, prints look good. Buy a couple of ink paper combo packs. It comes with a very little paper initially. Satisfied with my purchase, daughter was thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer! Good quality printed photos, easy to hook up and use!
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer! Good quality printed photos, easy to hook up and use! Got this for my teen daughter for Christmas 2018. She had it hooked up, app downloaded, and was printing her own collage photos in no time. She spent 2 hours on Christmas night having fun printing, trimming, and putting the photos up around her room. Mom win! : )
customer_reviews.author: Kittens & Chickens

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and setup, decent photo quality but not amazing...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup, except for the tray which was a bit tight. Printed right away with some very MINOR streaking that many might not have noticed. The color doesn't pop, and does not look as good as sending away for photos from a professional service. I'd use this for photos you want to stick on your fridge or bring to your office.
customer_reviews.author: Mark T

customer_reviews.title: Not best for parties. Couldn't connect via mobile.
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to print from mobile. Tried for hours. Could not use for photo booth idea. The ink runs out after 6 pictures and that was just testing designs to get it on photo booth feature. This will just sit and collect dust since it couldn't work for our event.
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: Fun little portable photo booth printer
customer_reviews.text: Wow this thing was a hit at our company party. It’s got WiFi so we connected it to an app on the iPad to make a photo booth and everyone loved it. The print speed is a bit slow at a little over a minute from file send to being done, but the prints were great little souvenirs to take home. Now I’ve used it at home to get prints off my phone. They are a little small at 4x6 but the quality is good. Just be sure to have good color on your phone and the prints will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Bryan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect replacement for my normal printer, I have to downsize all of my craft items since we are going to be full time RVers...This is perfect and the print quality is GREAT. I really like that when you need ink, you need paper it is a one in one and I love that.
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Pharmacy quality prints without the drive / wait.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Easily works with AirPrint. Surprisingly good quality. I had tempered expectations based on reviews. Look. If you’re a professional photographer, yea, you’re obviously not gonna 5 star this. If you hate having to drive to the pharmacy, wait and use their terrible website and slow service staff just to get a few pictures you need for a project, this is the machine for you. If you buy this, you basically have a store quality printer at the comfort of your home.
customer_reviews.author: KN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. This was my first time printing a photo. Didn’t use the app yet just AirPrint from my iPhone. Will explore more but so far it’s simple and photo seems clear of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Photo Printer for the Price!!
customer_reviews.text: Small compact printer with great quality. Connects to iPhone thru wifi no problem at all. Also has an app you can download if needed to print. Only downside is it does not come with everything you need to start printing right away. you will need to buy color cartridges and more photo paper with this because it only comes with a few prints and a black and white cartridge. Other than that i would recommend this to anyone. Great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift to use for a photo album for my friends newborn and the quality actually came out amazing. We set it up in a matter of minutes and had a picture printed. It’s worth the $ in my opinion. If something happens after more uses I’d contact the seller
customer_reviews.author: Beverly venable

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this portable printer
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised with this small printer . The colors and quality of prints appear to be quite well. I snake have 2 other portable orbiters for mobile printing in the go but this Canon really is a lot better for quality of prints and color. A little bigger then most portable printers as you certainly can not fit in a purse.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to set up and it's very user friendly. The only drawback to it is the colors aren't very bright and skin tones are washed out. It works for what we use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Padgett

customer_reviews.title: VERY COOL PHOTO PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed one for 2 months - worked perfectly. One thing I discovered: I had to remove the Canon Android app from my Samsung Note 9 that I already used before, and download a fresh one. I bet it's a software bug (fmr PC mfg engineer). Would not let go of the borrowed SELPHY! As we in the industry would say: When in doubt, reinstall.
customer_reviews.author: Sempre Valente

customer_reviews.title: Buy the extended warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are stellar quality. Only complaint is how fragile the doors are and paper feed compartment are.
customer_reviews.author: Puma1966

customer_reviews.title: Printer Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Was excited about getting this product it had great reviews. When I pressed the power button it didn't turn on right away. Pressed it again it came on but was stuck at a bright blank screen and then shutt off on its own. Tried to turn on again and same thing happened. Returned product for refund.
customer_reviews.author: M Costa

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: This printer is super easy to set up and use. Love the WiFi options. The pictures look great! Be warned you need to order the paper and ink with it because the cartridge that comes with it is a sample pack and will only be enough for 3 or 4 pictures.
customer_reviews.author: BookLover

customer_reviews.title: DOESN’T WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be returning this! It did not work. I connected it to wifi, and it would not register on multiple devices that I tried to connect it to. I googled and youtubed the set up for this. Extrememy disappointed because this ruined the Photobooth at my client’s party. Airprint feature was a bust!
customer_reviews.author: DoneciaV

customer_reviews.title: Not if you want good photos
customer_reviews.text: The photo quality if a bit better than below average. The app is awful and not user friendly. It wasted 6 sheets trying to print a colllage before giving up. This was a waste of time and money. I have yet to get a decent quality print.
customer_reviews.author: TScott

customer_reviews.title: UGH - Costly issues
customer_reviews.text: Look at the photos I posted - the film from the (fairly new) cartridge got stuck to the paper and ruined the entire cartridge. When I put in the new cartridge it prints a blue glob onto the picture. This printer is finicky, loud and frankly I wish I had never bought it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: E. DeJesus

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t connect to my WiFi well and was sooo slow to print. I didn’t like this one bit. Ruined my photo booth.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vota

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good quality prints
customer_reviews.text: This product is incredible. I'm not particularly savy with system set up type of situations and even I had no trouble in start up. This does work with apple airprint, after you install and link the Canon print app. It does take two full minutes to print one image, seems to take a long time sending the image through airprint. Print quality truly is impressive. I am a novice photographer and purchased this to easily print pictures of new baby to mail to family. Couldn't be more thrilled with this purchase. Even hubby is interested!!
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MINI-PRINTER
customer_reviews.text: Terrific mini-printer; excellent 4" x 6" color photos are clear, sharp and vibrant. Works flawlessly BUT I think you will need to download the Canon Selphy App to make it a complete printer. Hooked it up to my Kindle Tablet and will do the same for my Asus ZenPad 10. You will need to download the Canon Selphy App from Modil 1 as Amazon does not offer it and they SELL this printer. Not the way to support customers who buy this printer. Sideload the app from Mobil 1 or Google App Store.
customer_reviews.author: FredSG

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the quality of these prints. This is a must have if you are looking for a fun project printer. I bought this for my company's take your child to work day I can't wait to see what it can do when it is put to the test.
customer_reviews.author: A. Guisgand

customer_reviews.title: Good print quality but diffucult attaching to computer.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice printer and prints very nice prints. The only thing I do not like about it, it is very difficult to attach to my laptop, wireless. I have tried several times to attach to my laptop by wireless and by using a ubs cord. Had no luck. If I had known ahead of time I was going to have this kind of trouble I would not have purchased. My main reason for purchase was so I could attach it to my laptop. The print quality is good though.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: Please don’t waste your money, the printer itself is somewhat decent but the associated app needed to do the actual printing is far below standard, unable to even select images in the app to print without restarting the app at least 5-7 times per image
customer_reviews.author: Ted J.

customer_reviews.title: Fun and nice quality photo printer
customer_reviews.text: Great little photo printer. We have a color laser printer but I wasn’t impressed with photo print quality so I bought this and am glad I did. I love that you can buy a backup battery so you can print without needing to be plugged in. Makes it very versatile for many situations.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived totally smashed with scotch tape holding the lid down... never mind that one side was smashed in and the other wide open. The charger, ink cartridge, and cord unusable. I can’t speak to the quality of the product other than to say it’s unusable
customer_reviews.author: Lauraleigh

customer_reviews.title: SO CONVENIENT! Occasional printing flaw
customer_reviews.text: So convenient and quick! Great quality 4x6 pictures! Had trouble getting the app to find the wifi and the printer, but once that was done it has been very user friendly! From time to time, a photo will print with an ink mistake and I have to reprint. Disappointed with that flaw. A waste of ink and photo paper.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Printer jams are impossible to fix without wasting paper and cartridge!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer May 1st 2020, have only used a hand full of times. Each time printing has worked fine UNTIL today. The photo on the left of the printer was in process when the printer started jamming and prints were coming out blurred. Cassette started spitting clear/colored film from back of machine. I pulled on film after cartridge would not eject, Film started pouring from the machine. I’m calling the manufacturer tomorrow to see what they will do about it. I’ve wasted two cartridges and multiple paper. For a machine that does not require ink, what a waste!!
customer_reviews.author: Elsa Tes

customer_reviews.title: Comes with few printer paper and ink
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it comes with a simple pack of printer paper and ink but you will need to buy the ink and paper set if you need to print more pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle D

product_meta.title: Canon SELPHY CP1300 Wireless Compact Photo Printer with AirPrint and Mopria Device Printing, Black (2234C001)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Printer OnlyIntroducing the SELPHY CP1300 wireless compact photo printer, the perfect portable photo printer for at home and on the go. Simply print with AirPrint1, your camera's memory card2, or from Facebook and Instagram with the Canon PRINT app3, so your memories are ready to share wherever you are! Even print fun collages with friends from multiple devices with Party Shuffle Print3 or 2"x6" photo booth layout prints. You choose the right size for the right photo from 4"x6", 2.1"x2.1" square and even sticker paper, all made to last up to 100 years4 and are even water resistant!
feature_bullets: Not only will your photos be instantly dry, but they will also look great for up to 100 years4 and are even water resistant
Enjoy the simplicity of connecting your smartphone and tablet with ease, through the Canon PRINT app3. You can even print directly from USB, or your camera's memory card2

With the tilting 3.2 inches LCD screen it's easy to choose, edit and print your favorite photos. Output tray capacity: paper tray: 18 Sheets with postcard size paper cassette. Operating Temperature is 5 – 40 degree Celsius

Print Resolution (Up to) Color256 Levels Per Color (16.8 Million Colors). Paper Sizes Postcard (4.0 x 6.0 inches), L Size (3.5 x 4.7 inches), Card Size (2.1 x 3.4 inches), Square Label (2.1 x 2.1 inches).Requires "Canon Print Plug in" available for free from the Amazon Appstore and an Amazon Fire Phone, Amazon Kindle Fire HD6 or HDX7 device or later running Fire OS 4.0 or later
The sleek, portable design lets you bring the SELPHY CP1300 with you and with the optional battery back you can print and share your memories wherever you are

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,468 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
